posts.name: Jean-Louis
posts.cooked:
I’m trying to understand the difference between “inset” and “outset” in a box or a block ?

  • Exemple 1 : inset
#box(fill: red, inset: (x: 10pt, y: 10pt), outset: (x: 0pt, y:0pt), stroke: 2pt)[My red box.]

  • Exemple 2 : outset
#box(fill: blue, inset: (x: 0pt, y: 0pt), outset: (x: 10pt, y:10pt), stroke: 2pt)[My blue box.]

What is the difference ?

Could you provide examples and explanations ?

Thanks a lot.
posts.raw:
I'm trying to understand the difference between "inset" and "outset" in a **box** or a **block** ?

- Exemple 1 : inset
```typ 
#box(fill: red, inset: (x: 10pt, y: 10pt), outset: (x: 0pt, y:0pt), stroke: 2pt)[My red box.]
```
![RedBox|131x56](upload://6mlvsur9M4G0zd5Gjiaj2BTxFBc.png)

- Exemple 2 : outset
```typ
#box(fill: blue, inset: (x: 0pt, y: 0pt), outset: (x: 10pt, y:10pt), stroke: 2pt)[My blue box.]
```
![BlueBox|137x54](upload://fSfr4ap2KjflzTf5nLJuKyvCTA3.png)



What is the difference ?

Could you provide examples and explanations ?

Thanks a lot.

posts.name: Nikolai Neff-Sarnow
posts.cooked:
Outset does not affect layout, inset does.
see here: Typst
posts.raw:
Outset does not affect layout, inset does.
see here: https://typst.app/project/rMIXEST1NkwULQsCtoPR24
